Publishing the Bill on Thursday, Mr Michael Gove said: There are areas of Ofsted inspections, such as community cohesion or regulations Michael Governing what students bring in in their lunchboxes at lunchtime, which are entirely peripheral.`` One of the problems with Ofsted inspections is that they are asked to inspect and measure for things which, by definition, are hard to judge and not central to what schools are about.
